lines.text: Have you been fired?

[brushing it off]
Fired?
[laughs]
Hahaha! Fired? Hahahaha
[more nervous now]
Then why is the car for sale?
[we see the car through the house window; in the side window there is a crudely written sign saying FORSALE]
Oh that? That's a mistake. That's one of Rimmer's cockups. That should read Fors Ale. A new beer we're advertising.
[as giving a slogan]
Fors Ale - keeps you hearty and hale.
Well I've never heard of it.
And you may never! Very hush hush.
The survey shows that...
[realizing the survey asked the wrong question]
... it shows that 90% of English families do not eat boot polish for breakfast.

[schmoozing]
Hugh, I loved your speech on abortion. It was really gorgeous.
Have you been able to find time for the survey in regard to the declining attendance in England's churches?
Yes, we have.
We've tried everything, you know... cutthroat bingo, hallucinogens in the wafers, neon lights for the graveyards, chapels on wheels, fifty-fifty drawings after communion...
Really?

[grabbing hold of his vestments]
And these clothes are a bit out-of-date for the 1960s.
Yes, well, we've done a great deal of research on the results of our religious polls and I believe we have discovered the true root of the problem.
What would that be?
God.
I had a nasty suspicion it was that.
It's just that people have a hard time believing in Him. So, get rid of the God and you'll do just fine.
Interesting. Sort of an "Our Father who *might be* in heaven"...
Yes, very good.

[after seeing Fromage faint]
What's the matter with Fromage?
Oh, these recent sex surveys have him worn out.

[on a television interview]
I have nothing against Buddhism, per se. It is possible for people to approach God in a great many ways... but there is no need to be silly about it!
Mr Blocket, you had been on rather acrimonious terms with the late Prime Minister
We had our differences
On one occasion, indeed on several occasions, you described him as a two-faced weasel-eyed git.
In the rough and tumble of parliamentary debate things are said that can often be misinterpreted but there was a lot of warmth there.
Don't let's go into bourgeois things like money! Talk to my agent!

[heckling]
What about the Old Age Pension?
Don't talk to me about "unemployment", young man! I was unemployed before you were born!

[In radio studio]
How do you feel about the violent heckling which punctuated your speech?
I am not saying that the Labour Party was *responsible* for this disgraceful episode. But I will say this - it did seem to be *organised*.
[Looks at Michael Rimmer through studio glass]
My spies tell me, not literally of course...
I've got the Olympic Heats tomorrow.
I've got the Olympic Heats tonight.

[to Mrs Ferret]
Care for a glass of Fors?

[to gentlemen of the press]
Are we mad? ARE WE MAD? Are we mad? ARE WE Mad?

[At identity parade]
I couldn't swear to it, but it might just possibly be the one in the green shirt.
That's about the only time we've been together. When there's a photographer around.
I'd just like to say that my talks with the President were wide-ranging, full, and exhaustive.
Don't worry Tom, we'll supply the tears.
Good God! The Continental Pig!
They'll be cutting off the electricity next!
Peter, I was just jotting down a few reasons why you might want to leave IOP and come over to us at the Fairburn Organisation.
[hands over cheque]
Oh yes, I see, that's very well put. Yes, I particularly like the noughts.
Good God! Is that our "Olde Humbug"?

[addressing man in studio audience]
You sir! What do you think about publicising people's personal sexual habits?
[Man hides his face in hands]
You seem to disapprove. I wonder if your wife agrees.
[Looks at woman next to him]
I'm not his wife, go away please!

[to audience]
Anyone else from Doncaster?
It's a pleasure!
I'd better go and look after Percy, he gets a bit broody.
I do think Doubt is a terribly important part of Belief. You mean if we were to phase out the God-side of our worship, we'd get better attendances?
A sort of "Our Father, which *might be* in Heaven"...
So for those who think the British Lion has lost its teeth, let them be warned that it can still give them a pretty nasty suck.
